declaration: template <typename ValueType, std::size_t... SizeInDimensions> struct dimensional_array;
briefDescription: A math-vector, matrix, or higher dimension array of numbers.
detailedDescription:
A math-vector, matrix, or higher dimension array of numbers.
That is, a 1- or multidimensional array, where the amount of values in template argument SizeInDimensions is the amount of dimensions of the array.

templateParameters.name: ValueType
templateParameters.description: The type of value contained by the dimension.

templateParameters.name: SizeInDimensions
templateParameters.description:
If this contains a single number, then dimensional_array is a math-vector/array, with the given size.
If this contains 2 numbers, then dimensional_array is a matrix/2d array, with the given amount of rows and column.
If this contains x numbers, then the pattern follows: dimensional_array is an x-dimensional array, with the given amount of elements in each dimension.

All values must be positive.

overloads.description: Constructs a dimension with uninitialized values.

Constructs a dimensional_array with the given values.
If the dimensional_array is a matrix, then the values are grouped together in rows, meaning you first provide the values for the first row, then the second, and so on and so forth.

items.name: at
items.briefDescription: Gets the element at the given column, row, etc.

overloads.description:
If the dimension is a vector, gets the element at the given index.
If the dimension is a matrix, gets the element at the given column and row.
This pattern follows for higher-dimensional array.

If this is given fewer indices than the dimensional_array has dimensions, for example at(1) for a matrix, then the remaining indices are assumed to be 0.

exceptions: Throws std::out_of_range if the given indices points to an element outside of the dimensional_array.

items.name: size_in_dimension
items.briefDescription: Gets the amount of elements the dimensional_array contains in the given dimension.

overloads.description: Gets the amount of elements the dimensional_array contains in the given dimension.

exceptions: Throws std::out_of_range If the given value is not within [0; amount of dimensions[.

memberGroups.description: These accessors are only available if the dimensional_array represents a vector or higher dimensional array.

Only available if the vector has the element.
This is the same as calling [[dimensional_array::at]](0).

items.name: [x,y,z,w][x,y,z,w]
items.briefDescription: Gets the element at the first/second/third/fourth column and first/second/third/fourth row.

overloads.description:
Gets the element at the first/second/third/fourth column and first/second/third/fourth row.
The name "[x,y,z,w][x,y,z,w]" should be understood as either:
-xx, xy, xz, xw,
-yx, yy, yz, yw,
-zx, zy, zz, zw,
-wx, wy, wz, ww.
